alert.note: Alert for Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Centennial Mountains, Island Park (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 30 at 2:59AM MST until December 31 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 12 inches, except 10 to 18 inches on ridge tops and elevations above passes. Areas of southwest wind of 10 to 20 mph with higher gusts will cause heavy drifting snow and low visibility in blowing snow. Morning and overnight temperatures will combine with the wind to produce effective chill temperatures of 10 below to 20 below zero degrees. * WHERE...The Centennial Mountains and the Island Park area, the Big Hole Mountains, and the Bear River Mountains including Emigrant Summit. This includes the towns of Victor, Kilgore, and Island Park. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Drifting snow will hamper efforts to keep roads and highways clear. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Centennial Mountains, Island Park
